definitions.usage: 指某事物（如颜色、声音、光线、记忆等）逐渐变得不明显或减弱，通常用于描述自然或渐进的过程。

examples.scene: 在一个安静的夏夜，你和朋友坐在阳台上聊天，远处的音乐声随着夜色加深逐渐变小。
examples.chineseIdea: 音乐的声音慢慢减弱，最终听不见，仿佛融入了夜晚的寂静。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: As the night deepened, the music from the distant festival @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: As the night deepened, the music from the distant festival 「faded away」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 随着夜色加深，远处节日里的音乐「逐渐消失」了。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'The music disappeared slowly.' 纠正：'The music faded away.'（'disappear'显得突兀，'fade away'更自然地表达渐进消失的过程）

examples.scene: 你在看一部电影，结尾处画面慢慢变暗，主角的身影逐渐融入背景中，留下深刻的印象。
examples.chineseIdea: 画面逐渐变暗，主角的形象好像被背景吞没，带来一种情感上的余韵。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: At the end of the movie, the hero’s figure @ @ the dark background.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: At the end of the movie, the hero’s figure 「faded into」 the dark background.
examples.chineseTranslation: 在电影的结尾，主人公的身影「融入」了黑暗的背景。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'The hero disappeared into the background.' 纠正：'The hero faded into the background.'（'disappear'缺少渐进感，'fade into'更符合画面渐变的效果）

definitions.usage: 指衣物、家具、照片等因时间、阳光或洗涤而失去原有的颜色或光泽。

examples.scene: 你有一件心爱的红色T恤，穿了很多年后，颜色不再鲜艳，变得有些暗淡。
examples.chineseIdea: T恤的红色因为反复洗涤和阳光照射，变得不再那么鲜亮。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: My favorite red T-shirt has @ @ @ after years of washing.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: My favorite red T-shirt has 「faded in color」 after years of washing.
examples.chineseTranslation: 我最喜欢的红色T恤在多年洗涤后「颜色褪色」了。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'The T-shirt’s color is not bright anymore.' 纠正：'The T-shirt has faded in color.'（'not bright'表达模糊，'fade in color'更精确地描述褪色现象）

examples.scene: 你家客厅的窗帘挂了几年，每天被阳光直射，原本深蓝的颜色现在看起来有些泛白。
examples.chineseIdea: 窗帘的颜色因为长时间暴露在阳光下，逐渐失去了原来的深蓝色。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The curtains in the living room have @ @ @ due to constant sunlight.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The curtains in the living room have 「faded from exposure」 due to constant sunlight.
examples.chineseTranslation: 客厅的窗帘由于长期暴露在阳光下「因曝晒褪色」了。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'The curtains’ color is gone because of sunlight.' 纠正：'The curtains have faded from exposure.'（'color is gone'过于绝对，'fade from exposure'更自然且准确）

definitions.meaning: （人或事物）逐渐失去重要性或影响力
definitions.usage: 指某人、某事或某种趋势逐渐退出公众视野或失去原有的地位，通常带有一种衰落的感觉。

examples.scene: 一位曾经红极一时的歌手，近年来越来越少出现在公众面前，粉丝们开始怀念他的辉煌时期。
examples.chineseIdea: 这位歌手的影响力逐渐减弱，仿佛从公众的视线中消失了。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: After his peak, the singer slowly @ @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: After his peak, the singer slowly 「faded from view」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 在巅峰之后，这位歌手慢慢地「从公众视野中消失」了。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'The singer is not popular anymore.' 纠正：'The singer has faded from view.'（'not popular'缺乏渐进感，'fade from view'更能表达逐渐退出公众视野的过程）

examples.scene: 你小时候特别喜欢的一个动画片，现在几乎没人提起，感觉它已经被新一代孩子遗忘了。
examples.chineseIdea: 这部动画片曾经很受欢迎，但现在已经很少被记住，像是被时间遗忘。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: That old cartoon has @ @ @ as new shows took over.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: That old cartoon has 「faded from memory」 as new shows took over.
examples.chineseTranslation: 随着新节目的兴起，那部老动画片已经「从记忆中消失」了。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'Nobody remembers that cartoon anymore.' 纠正：'That cartoon has faded from memory.'（'nobody remembers'显得生硬，'fade from memory'更具情感和渐进感）
